benchmark_details.name: PodSarc (Podcast Sarcasm)
benchmark_details.overview: PodSarc is a large-scale sarcastic speech dataset created using an annotation pipeline that leverages large language models (LLMs) for sarcasm detection in speech.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale annotated dataset for sarcasm detection in speech, enabling the development of models that can accurately identify sarcastic intent without visual context.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Although the dataset reduces manual annotation effort, some discrepancies may still exist in the annotations.

data.annotation: LLM-based annotations followed by human verification

methodology.calculation: F1 Score calculated based on model predictions and ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in sarcasm detection.
methodology.baseline_results: Achieved an F1 score of 73.63% using human-verified LLM annotations.
methodology.validation: Compared annotation quality and detection performance using the MUStARD++ dataset.
